basics.name: Kairus Noah Encarnacion Tecson
basics.label: Senior AI Software Engineer
basics.summary: Senior AI Software Engineer with a background as Head of Engineering, specializing in Production RAG Systems and Multi-Agent Orchestration for Healthcare and Defense. Expert in the full AI lifecycle—from architecting ReAct and Plan-and-Execute workflows to implementing rigorous LLM evaluation pipelines using LangSmith.

work.name: ArnoldAI
work.summary: Leading engineering for an AI platform providing chatbot agents, agent builder, and RAG systems for highly regulated industries.
highlights: Architected Multi-Agent Systems (MAS) using LangGraph, implementing ReAct agents and Plan-and-Execute patterns.
Engineered high-accuracy Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines for complex medical and defense protocols.
Implemented automated evaluation pipelines using LangSmith (LLM-as-a-Judge) to audit agent interactions.
Managed a team of 8, establishing Scrumban workflows and coding guidelines.
Migrated infrastructure from AWS to Hetzner bare-metal VMs using Terraform and Ansible, deploying via Kubernetes.

work.name: CoolRiots
work.summary: Architected a 'Generative UI' system that dynamically renders interactive dashboards from natural language queries.
highlights: Designed a Generative UI system using LLM Function Calling to render adaptive React components.
Pivoted from complex multi-agent proposal to streamlined single-agent architecture via prompt optimization.
Replaced Server-Side Rendering (SSR) overhead with client-side strategies to optimize performance.

education.institution: Batangas State University - The National Engineering University

projects.name: Dynamic UI: Generative AI Component Rendering
projects.description: Designed a 'Generative UI' Proof-of-Concept that utilizes LLM Function Calling to dynamically generate structured JSON payloads, rendering adaptive React components.
highlights: Utilized LLM Function Calling for dynamic structured JSON generation.
Rendered adaptive React components (charts, forms, tables) based on natural language.

projects.name: Bath and Bark
highlights: Engineered a serverless backend using FastAPI, SQLModel, and Pydantic.
Built full inventory and appointment management system with Swagger API documentation.

projects.name: Trashbox-ARD
highlights: Developed solid waste image classification model robust against adversarial attacks.
Engineered for space and time efficiency using Knowledge Distillation.

projects.name: Artemis
highlights: Built an IoT-connected waste tracking system with Express.js and Firebase backend.
Implemented real-time monitoring via Firestore and automated CRON tasks.

projects.name: Clinical-RAG
projects.description: Production-grade, citation-backed AI system designed to bridge the 'Trust Gap' in medical information retrieval.
highlights: Orchestration: LangGraph for stateful, multi-agent workflows.
Vector Infrastructure: Milvus for high-concurrency similarity search.
Deployed on AWS (ECS Fargate) with CI/CD via GitHub Actions.

projects.name: chat-man
projects.description: Experimental playground for agentic LM chat workflows and real-time API integrations.
highlights: Exploration of different real-time API communications.
Prototyping of agentic workflows using Jupyter Notebooks.

achievements.title: Champion
achievements.summary: Ranked 1st among 124 students, solving complex programming challenges with PHP.

achievements.title: 2nd Runner Up
achievements.summary: Proposed an AI-powered proctoring system for VR examinations. Theme: 'Intersection of AI and Education'.

achievements.title: 3rd Runner Up
achievements.event: Kadakareer x HelpBridge: Business Challenge Hackathon
achievements.summary: Delivered a business strategy for a Hong Kong startup, creating high-fidelity wireframes.
